title: Esophageal Carcinoma
diagnosis_topic: Malignant tumor of the esophagus requiring multimodal therapy
setup_script: A 60-year-old man with a long history of smoking and alcohol use presents with progressive dysphagia to solids then liquids. He has lost 15 lbs over 3 months.

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 115/70 mmHg, HR 95 bpm, RR 18/min, Temp 37.2 C.
Circumferential mass at the distal third of the esophagus; biopsies reveal adenocarcinoma.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident orders endoscopic ultrasound and CT/PET
dynamic_flow.reply: T3 lesion invading adventitia with suspected peri-esophageal lymph nodes; no distant metastasis on PET.
BMI 19 kg/m2; albumin 3.0 g/dL; may require feeding jejunostomy pre-treatment.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident discusses neoadjuvant chemoradiation (CROSS regimen)
dynamic_flow.reply: Carboplatin, paclitaxel and radiotherapy for 5 weeks followed by restaging.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If restaging shows downstaging and no metastasis
dynamic_flow.reply: Plan for transthoracic (Ivor Lewis) esophagectomy with gastric pull-up and two-field lymphadenectomy.
Tumor progresses beyond curative stage; palliative stent placement for dysphagia may be needed.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If patient is early stage T1a
dynamic_flow.reply: Endoscopic mucosal resection or submucosal dissection considered without surgery.
Respiratory complications, anastomotic leak, recurrent laryngeal nerve injury and chylothorax.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident arranges postoperative ICU care
dynamic_flow.reply: Early extubation, chest physiotherapy and jejunal feeding started day 1.
CT and endoscopy every 6 months for 2 years then annually; monitor nutritional status.
Smoking cessation, alcohol abstinence and involvement of support groups.

critical_decision_points: Diagnosis and staging of esophageal cancer using endoscopic ultrasound, CT and PET
Neoadjuvant chemoradiation for locally advanced disease
Surgical approaches to esophagectomy and postoperative management
Consideration of endoscopic therapy for early lesions
Long-term surveillance and management of nutrition and complications
